pr_title: Fix the bug introduced in #5132 where ScanBasedDocIdIterator.isMatch() is still required

timeline.message:
Fix the bug introduced in #5132 where ScanBasedDocIdIterator.isMatch() is still required

ScanBasedDocIdIterator.isMatch() is still required when the query is in the following format:
SELECT ... WHERE (filterA OR filterB) AND filterC
And filterC is working on a scan-based column (column without inverted index)

Enhance the HybridClusterIntegrationTest to catch this issue

timeline.bodyText: Can you restructure the (outer) loop so that it is a while with some condition rather than a for(i = ..) in which we change the loop counter? I understand it was already that way.
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: @mcvsubbu Planning to do some clean-up in the following pr. Wanted to keep this pr small and focus on the bug fix.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Is it the test case mentioned in the description section? It doesn't seem matched with SELECT ... WHERE (filterA OR filterB) AND filterC though.
timeline.author: jackjlli

replies.bodyText:
@jackjlli Yes, for hybrid use case, there will be an implicit time filter appended. This is the query that failed before.
